alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 28 at 4:03AM AKST until March 01 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow reducing visibility to near zero at times. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall east of Nome.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
